title: Zero-downtime with Rails credentials
excerpt: Transitioning the codebase from using environment variables to Rails Credentials for Zero-Downtime Deploys.
highlights:
Highlight:Environment variables are not encrypted and therefore they can not be stored in any form of version control.

Highlight:makes it easier to add new credentials because you don’t need to tell other developers to add them to their own .env file.

Highlight:changes to the environment variables are only picked up when you restart the server and not when you simply reload the server.

Highlight:This hot-reloads the puma server and does not cause any downtime.
